intro: Heliophila dissecta, commonly known as the slender heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its delicate structure and floral display make it a notable species in botanical gardens and natural habitats. Heliophila dissecta is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
